(南澳; Nán'ào), also Nan-ao, is a city in
. It has a significant aboriginal population.
Nanao is served by train. The station is in the center of town.  If you're coming by car, Nanao is at about the 130km mark on Provincial Highway 9.
The popular places to get around in Nanao include the hot springs and the waterfall.
is a fairly new building built to promote the Atayal culture. The exterior and interior of the building are designed and decorated with Atayal unique totem.

" Fishing bay of Nan-ao" began to work to build in 1993, in addition to the whole ground, the manufacture of rhombus piece, building the south, north outside breakwater, and wharfs for 300 meters. Located the fishing bay of Nan-ao of a sea shore of Chao-Yang neighbor, the north contain Wu-shi-bi for natural cover. Due to the Abundant water resource nearby, the fishing bay of Nan-ao can be used as the fishing place to snare fishes. Fishing bay of Nan-ao is also one of the abundant fishing grounds.

is located at a resting spot next to Ye-jia-xiang exhibition center, with the view of the beautiful mountain mist of Nan-ao, located half-way along Suhua Highway. The visitors can visit and understand the meaning of the Bell of the Sha-yun for Nan-ao.
